intro: Ludwigia stenorraphe subsp. reducta, commonly known as the narrowleaf Ludwigia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Onagraceae. It is native to parts of South America, particularly Brazil, and is often found in wetland and aquatic environments. The plant is characterized by its slender, elongated leaves and small, pink to red flowers that bloom throughout the growing season. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant in water gardens and pond settings due to its aesthetic appeal. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both horticultural and ecological studies.
